metadata.titel_preek: Easter Season Sermons: The Night, Thomas, and Job

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades the realm of Death and the darkness of human doubt to reveal Himself and grant life where there is only dust.

tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
The risen, living, reigning Christ says to us today...
God has entered our pain and been wounded by it... yet has been raised triumphant.

object.identificatie: Life, Revelation, and the 'Who' (God's own self)
tekstueel_bewijs: receive the gift of eternal light and life in his name
God has come to meet Job, and nothing is the same after that
the living Word of God, which is unique and trustworthy
to the believers and doubters yet to come, to you and to me

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Word / The Wounds of Jesus
tekstueel_bewijs: Through the Word of God the Holy Spirit creates such faith
it is the Word of Jesus that creates faith
the night in which Sin and Death reign
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not a moral failure but an ontological and cosmic power that 'obliterates human hope'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of faith and confession following the encounter with the Risen Lord.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / Thomas / Job
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human response (Program 2) is strictly a consequence of God's action (Program 1).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God → Eternal Life → The Doubting Hearer

voorbeelden_god_subject: He arose from the kingdom of Death.
The living Son of God had appeared to him personally.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Mary Magdalene came to the tomb.
We can choose a god who suits us.
Job simply sets aside all his great sufferings.

voorbeelden: we just have to help each other through it
Job's great longing is for revelation
they did not know the scripture
having power to grant his divine life
God has a power that he cannot discern

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'ability' to do what man cannot. It is a theology of Divine Power (Grace) rather than Human Obligation (Law).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Night) to ~S1 (Doubt/Dust) to S1 (Life) via the event of the Resurrection.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved not by human understanding, but by the 'Who'—the presence of the Risen Christ.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; Death is described as 'merciless' and 'irrevocable'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the primary actor who initiates salvation and revelation while humans are in a state of 'night' or 'dust'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: None found; even faith is described as created by the Spirit.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.
The reign of Death is stark, merciless, irrevocable.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are used as 'types' of the human condition (doubters, sufferers) rather than moral examples to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already uses a theocentric reading: God meets Thomas/Job in their incapacity.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'doing' is replaced by the gift of 'seeing'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace: God works, man receives.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The three sections (Mary, Thomas, Job) are perfectly integrated into a single narrative of God's self-revelation in the 'night'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He arose from the kingdom of Death and carried away its spoils.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit creates the faith that the human Subject lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is linked to the 'night' and 'death'—a state of being rather than just a list of misdeeds.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. God is the Subject, Death is the Opponent, and the Hearer is the Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for Easter.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon avoids the trap of 'exemplarism' and 'moralism' by keeping the focus on the agency of the Risen Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would look at the use of 'Night' as a metaphor, semiotics shows 'Night' as an Actant (Opponent) that defines the Subject's (Christ) mission.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains John 20; semiotics explains how the sermon's 'engine' moves the hearer from death to life.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-switch' where human effort (Mary's spices, Thomas's demands) is replaced by Divine Performance.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's grammar of grace almost perfectly.
